page.title: 11TANDLE HILL COUNTRY PARK
page.content:
AMENITIES AND WILD LIFE
In Tandle Hill Country Park there is a Pets Corner, a nature trail, a picnic site and a Golf Course. The golf course has 18 holes. A charge of 50p for adults and 35p for children is made for a game of golf. There are about 4,000 trees in Tandle Hill Park. A warden looks after the park and the trees. Most of the trees are Beech trees, but there are also Silver Birch, Scots Pine and Oak. A lovely place in the park is the Rhododendron Walk, where the pathway twists between high Rhododendron bushes. In the park there are wild rabbits, squirrels, foxes, badgers and weasels.
